Contribute Contribute Contribute Scott E Joyner 2025 Mayor | New York City Joyner For Mayor $50 $100 $150 $500 $1050 NYC resident? With matching funds, your $0.00 contribution can be worth $0.00 . $0.00 $0.00 Go Go All fields are required unless otherwise noted. Apt / Suite / Floor (optional) AK AL AR AS AZ CA CO CT DC DE FL GA GU HI IA ID IL IN KS KY LA MA MD ME MI MN MO MP MS MT NC ND NE NH NJ NM NV NY OH OK OR PA PR RI SC SD TN TX UM UT VA VI VT WA WI WV WY N/A Go If a contributor has business dealings with the City as defined in the Campaign Finance Act, such contributor may give only up to $250 for city council member, $320 for borough president, and $400 for mayor, public advocate or comptroller. Go Rules on Contributions from People Doing Business with the City of New York A “doing business” contributor is a lobbyist, principal owner, principal officer, or senior manager of an entity or firm that presently does business with the City, or within the past 12 months, has done business with the City or has bid or applied for business with the City. Organizations that are “doing business” with the city generally fit one of the following descriptions: Contributors are not considered to be doing business with the City simply because they pay or receive a rebate on City taxes, work for the City, are in a City pension plan, hire a lobbyist, apply for permits for a 1, 2, or 3 family home, drive a City taxi, or apply for street activity permits or other kinds of individual activities with the City. Contributions from or intermediated by persons doing business with the City will not be matched with public funds. For more details or to verify whether you are listed on the Doing Business database, see http://www.nyccfb.info/candidate-services/doing-business-faqs/ All fields are required unless otherwise noted. I hereby affirm that I was not, nor, to my knowledge, was anyone else, reimbursed in any manner for this contribution; that this contribution is not being made as a loan; and that this contribution is being made from my personal funds or my personal account, which has no corporate or business affiliation. Black Men Working By Black Men Working The "Black Men Working" podcast is designed to highlight the hard working, everyday, Black Man in America. We will get to know him, what he does, how he does it, why he does it and so much more. Through this process we hope to establish a deeper bond between Black Men and strengthen our network and our net worth to ultimately do more good for our people. Available on Ep.5 - Former NYC Mayoral Candidate Scott Joyner Black Men Working Dec 18, 2018 Black Men Working Dec 18, 2018 00:00 00:00 23:03 Ep.16 - FilmMaker Tess Salomon Tess Salomon is an 18yr old young man who turned a comic he began, as a byproduct of being on punishment, into a film that was selected for screening at the 2nd Annual Teen Film Festival on March 15th, 2019 at the historical Museum of the Moving Image. Listen to the multitude of wisdom this young brother drops in this dynamic, once in a lifetime interview! Mar 18, 2019 30:21 Ep.15 - Author Keith Kareem Williams Author, Screenwriter and single Dad, Keith Kareem Williams is a passionate, committed and brilliant author of 17, soon to be 18, books! His journey is inspiring to say the least! Listen, learn and be inspired! Mar 15, 2019 46:02 Ep.14 - Jessie Jones, Special Educator in the D.O.E. Jessie Jones, from Harlem, NY, is a special educator in the Department of Education working with children on the Autism spectrum. He is extremely passionate not only about creating a safe space for some of our most marginalized children, but he believes in his heart that those on the Autism spectrum are great and just need a little love to go on to do wondrous things in life. Jessie Jones, from Harlem, NY, is a special educator in the Department of Education working with children on the Autism spectrum. He is extremely passionate not only about creating a safe space for some of our most marginalized children, but he believes in his heart that those on the Autism spectrum are great and just need a little love to go on to do wondrous things in life. Jan 23, 2019 29:16 Ep.13 - Deyquan Alston, CEO of Black Line Rentals At just 23 years young, Deyquan Alston is the sole owner of Black Line Rentals, a luxury car rental company servicing individuals in the NY/NJ area. Since a youth, this brother was always working and striving to merge his passion for driving with making money. Well, he turned 23 last week and has since bought his 4th and 5th cars to add to his ever growing fleet of pearly white luxury cars! Man! I think he'll be ok. Listen to and share this interview. Jan 21, 2019 26:10 Ep.12 - Media Mogul, Cyrus Webb Cyrus Webb is an independent Media Mogul! This brother from Mississippi literally does it all! Not only does he have his very own magazine, radio show and tv show, which includes traveling to various cities interviewing people on location, but he is a top 200 reviewer on Amazon, does branding, marketing and I a multi-published author! man o man! He's absolutely crushing it right now and I think we all can benefit from listening to brother Cyrus Webb. Visit his website to gain access to the radio show, tv show, magazine and everything else he's into. www.cyruswebb.com www.cyruswebb.com Jan 18, 2019 44:34 Ep.11 - Comedian Kareem Green aka Mr. Must See! Kareem Green aka Mr. Must See, is a stand up comedian, actor and writer who has been performing professionally for over 20yrs. He has been featured on various major platforms including HBO and Showtime At The Apollo, as well, he has performed internationally and has been the winner of multiple competitions! He is a living legend and it was an honor to have him on the show. Listen. Learn. Share. Kareem Green aka Mr. Must See, is a stand up comedian, actor and writer who has been performing professionally for over 20yrs. He has been featured on various major platforms including HBO and Showtime At The Apollo, as well, he has performed internationally and has been the winner of multiple competitions! He is a living legend and it was an honor to have him on the show. Listen. Learn. Share. Jan 01, 2019 58:31 Ep.10 - Jermain Smith, Children's Book Author In this episode I sat down with Children's book author, Screenwriter and visionary, 26yr old brother Jermain

Mar 18, 2019 30:21 Ep.15 - Author Keith Kareem Williams Author, Screenwriter and single Dad, Keith Kareem Williams is a passionate, committed and brilliant author of 17, soon to be 18, books! His journey is inspiring to say the least! Listen, learn and be inspired! Mar 15, 2019 46:02 Ep.14 - Jessie Jones, Special Educator in the D.O.E. Jessie Jones, from Harlem, NY, is a special educator in the Department of Education working with children on the Autism spectrum. He is extremely passionate not only about creating a safe space for some of our most marginalized children, but he believes in his heart that those on the Autism spectrum are great and just need a little love to go on to do wondrous things in life. Jan 23, 2019 29:16 Ep.13 - Deyquan Alston, CEO of Black Line Rentals At just 23 years young, Deyquan Alston is the sole owner of Black Line Rentals, a luxury car rental company servicing individuals in the NY/NJ area. Since a youth, this brother was always working and striving to merge his passion for driving with making money. Well, he turned 23 last week and has since bought his 4th and 5th cars to add to his ever growing fleet of pearly white luxury cars! Man! I think he'll be ok. Listen to and share this interview. Jan 21, 2019 26:10 Ep.12 - Media Mogul, Cyrus Webb Cyrus Webb is an independent Media Mogul! This brother from Mississippi literally does it all! Not only does he have his very own magazine, radio show and tv show, which includes traveling to various cities interviewing people on location, but he is a top 200 reviewer on Amazon, does branding, marketing and I a multi-published author! man o man! He's absolutely crushing it right now and I think we all can benefit from listening to brother Cyrus Webb. Visit his website to gain access to the radio show, tv show, magazine and everything else he's into. www.cyruswebb.com www.cyruswebb.com Jan 18, 2019 44:34 Ep.11 - Comedian Kareem Green aka Mr. Must See! Kareem Green aka Mr. Must See, is a stand up comedian, actor and writer who has been performing professionally for over 20yrs. He has been featured on various major platforms including HBO and Showtime At The Apollo, as well, he has performed internationally and has been the winner of multiple competitions! He is a living legend and it was an honor to have him on the show. Listen. Learn. Share. Jan 01, 2019 58:31 Ep.10 - Jermain Smith, Children's Book Author In this episode I sat down with Children's book author, Screenwriter and visionary, 26yr old brother Jermain

Smith of Brooklyn, NY. His children's book "Brooklyn Astronaut: Jamuel's Journey To The Moon" is a story about mentorship, community and believing you can do the impossible. Dec 30, 2018 32:04 Ep.9 - Kenny Carter, Fathers Alive In The Hood Kenny Carter is the founder and president of Fathers Alive In The Hood, Inc. (F.A.I.T.H), a powerful community based organization that has been consistent in mentoring, first responders, charity and much, much more. Based in NYC, but impacting lives around the country, F.A.I.T.H., led by the powerful spirit of brother Kenny Carter, is one of the first organizations many people call when the presence of positive, strong Black Men are needed most. It was a joy to get into the mind and heart snd gain a deeper understanding of why Mr. Carter does the work that he does. Listen and Share. Dec 30, 2018 50:57 Ep.8 - Taji Dean Ali, Author of "All Wins, No Losses: Secrets To Living Life Undefeated" Taji Dean Ali is a writer and storyteller at heart! It's not just what he does, it's who he is. When I met him years ago, he was a performing hip-hop artist. He was good too! Today, he's the author of a book that is adding so much value to the lives of many! What's even more amazing to me is the fact he spent 2 years of his life living in the mountains, on a quest for spiritual enlightenment. Man! This conversation is amazing! Listen and share! Dec 27, 2018 26:12 Ep.6 - "Sacrifice Creates Opportunity" Featuring SCO Flair, Artist Extraordinaire On Sunday, December 16th, at a Chipotle in NYC, I sat down with 26 yr old SCO Flair out of Southeast Washington, DC. He was in NYC for a musical performance. This brother embodies every aspect of the word Artist - clothing designer, painter, hip-hop artist and so much more. His energy is exhilarating! We spoke about his passion for all things art, his commitment to fatherhood, the passing of his beloved grandmother and what he would be doing if he wasn't a working artist. Be inspired! Dec 25, 2018 22:26 Ep.5 - Former NYC Mayoral Candidate Scott Joyner I was humbled and excited to sit down with brother Scott Joyner, 31yrs old, originally from Brooklyn, but currently in Chelsea, NY. Brother Scott is a field bike mechanic with CitiBike and a manager at Family Dollar. Brother Scott has high political hopes and states "I'm not a politician. I am a public servant. And that's what our communities need more of. Public servants instead of career politicians." Listen to our conversation and share with your network. Dec 07, 2018 35:02 Ep3. - James White - From quitting his job to earning 6 figures. How he did it and WHY? Listen to how a 17yr old boy who quit his job is earning 6 figures at the age of 33.
